{{Taxobox | name = Dinichthyloidea | image = Dunkleosteus BW.jpg | image_width = 220px | image_caption = drawing of ''[[Dunkleosteus]]'' | fossil_range = Late [[Silurian]]? to Late [[Devonian]] | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordata]] | subphylum = [[Vertebrata]] | infraphylum = [[Gnathostomata]] | classis = [[Placodermi]] | ordo = [[Arthrodira]] | subordo = [[Brachythoraci]] | infraordo = [[Coccosteina]] | superfamilia = '''Dinichthyloidea''' | superfamilia_authority = Newberry, 1885 | subdivision_ranks = [[Family (biology)|Families]] | subdivision = See text }}
The '''Dinichthyloidea''' were a [[Taxonomic rank|superfamily]] of [[placoderm]]s, armored fish most diverse during the [[Devonian]]. They contain numerous extremely large [[species]], such as ''[[Titanichthys agassizi]]'' which fed on small animals and the [[apex predator]] ''[[Dunkleosteus terrelli]]''.
==Systematics== * [[Basal (evolution)|Basal]] [[genus]] ''[[Erromenosteus]]'' * [[Family (biology)|Family]] [[Dinichthyidae]] * Family [[Trematosteidae]] * Family [[Rachiosteidae]] * Family [[Pachyosteidae]] * Family [[Titanichthyidae]] * Family [[Bungartiidae]] * Family [[Selenosteidae]] * Family [[Mylostomatidae]]
